tool_description: Validates backup file integrity by checking file existence, size constraints, checksums, and basic readability tests for backup artifacts.

backup_path.description: Full path to backup file or directory

expected_min_size_mb.description: Minimum expected backup size in megabytes

expected_max_size_mb.description: Maximum expected backup size in megabytes

checksum_algorithm.description: Checksum algorithm to use (md5, sha1, sha256, sha512)

validate_content.description: Whether to perform deep content validation (slower)

expected_checksum.description: Expected checksum value for comparison, if available

error_messages: File not found: The backup_path does not exist or is inaccessible.
Size validation failed: Backup file size is outside the expected range [expected_min_size_mb, expected_max_size_mb].
Checksum mismatch: Calculated checksum does not match expected_checksum value.
Content validation failed: Backup file appears corrupted or unreadable during deep validation.
Invalid algorithm: Use one of [md5, sha1, sha256, sha512] for checksum_algorithm.
Access permissions error: Insufficient file system permissions to read backup file.
usage: Provide backup_path and size constraints. Optionally enable validate_content for thorough checks or provide expected_checksum for verification.

file_size_mb.description: Actual backup file size in megabytes

calculated_checksum.description: Computed checksum of the backup file

failed_checks.description: List of validation checks that failed
